page.title: 01Part Of Knapdale Forest
page.content: This area is a piece of hill country lying at a height from 150m to 270m. It is owned by the forestry commission & British Waterways. For the former it is part of Knapdale Forest & is planted with conifers, mainly sitka spruce. They vary in age from fully mature stands in the NW, which are at present being clear felled, to new plantatings at the Southern edge. Within the area are three small lochs & seven reservoirs, many of which were natural lochs which have been enlarged by damming. There are owned by British Waterways and are used to feel the top reach at the Crinan Canal. There are brown trout in them and they are fished by the Loch Gilphead Angling Club. There is a forest road road running approximately NS through the area which gives access to all the dams of the reservoirs.
